demos package¶

Submodules¶

demos.curvature_refinement module¶

Example of curvature refinement procedure. We compare a coarse B-spilne (without refinement) to an adapted B-spline, with the second one being much smoother in the areas with high curvature.

>>>    bspline = Example_BSpline(n=100, refine=False)
>>>    bspline.plot(linetype="o-", color="red", show=False)

>>>    bspline = Example_BSpline(n=100, refine=True)
>>>    bspline.plot(linetype="*-")

demos.demo_bspline module¶

Basic usage of pysplines Create and plot and example B-spline with given control points cv and of degree 3.

>>> cv = [
>>>    [0.0, 0.0],
>>>    [0.1, 0.1],
>>>    [0.2, -0.1],
>>>    [0.3, 0.2],
>>>    [0.4, 0.0],
>>>    [0.5, 0.1]
>>> ]
demos.demo_bspline.create_bspline()[source]¶

demos.mass_matrices module¶

Illustrates the mass matrix of an Example_Bspline with 6 basis functions. Use bspline.mass_matrix(DLMM=True) to get the diagonal only elements of the mass matrix.

demos.perf_measure module¶

This demo illustrates the performance of a simple B-spline constructor. The bottleneck of the performance is the bspline_basis method, which solely relies on the sympy bspline basis generating method.

demos.t_from_bspl_point module¶

We predict the internal parameter value of a B-spline near a trial_point.
